description:
Google relies on gTech’s Velocity team (gV) to transform and improve people’s lives through big-bet products and services like Search, Google Assistant, and Actions on Google. Our mission is to activate, accelerate, and scale Google’s biggest bets by being trusted advisors to internal and external partners.

As a Partner Vertical Manager, you will be responsible for driving the global actions for Google (AoG) strategic partner strategy for Assistant verticals (e.g., food ordering, my services, productivity, delight, auto, health and fitness, etc). You will lead a team of individual contributors to achieve Google’s AoG partner goals as well as influence the overall developer strategy.

Your team will be responsible for enhancing the Assistant product by adding delightful, innovative and assistive experiences, working with strategic partners. These initiatives are critical for Google’s future growth and require fast decision-making with many teams across Google. We are looking for an experienced people leader who is passionate about building a highly effective organization with experience coaching and mentoring teams. AoG is a complex business and you will be required to help define and lead the strategy with numerous cross-functional teams as well as multiple product areas. This is a new product and requires a leader who will understand the technical challenges that partners will face to effectively influence product strategy.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in Partner Engineering, Product Management, Project Management and/or Engineering Management.
  • 1 year of experience managing teams.
  • Experience in web and mobile technologies and design, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript and frameworks such as AngularJS and Node.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to influence and lead cross-functional stakeholders with excellent partner engagement skills.
  • Ability to streamline complex processes and implement workflows designed to increase efficiency.
  • Ability to manage multiple, time-sensitive projects with competing priorities while working independently to drive projects to completion with minimum guidance and high attention to detail.
  • Excellent project and/or program management skills, leading and implementing high-impact projects with cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and effective interpersonal and analytical skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead a team of partner technology managers and solutions consultants to establish business operational processes and core metrics for success.
  • Develop and manage strategic initiatives across cross-functional stakeholders (e.g., Engineering, Product Management, Business Development, Sales, Marketing) to engage new partners, improve the overall on-boarding process and support product launches globally.
  • Define, establish, measure and report on metrics to analyze the partner experience and internal efficiency, including customer service level agreements and support volumes.
  • Oversee all aspects of the Actions on Google (AoG) strategic partner efforts for a set of verticals. Partner with the business to evaluate the productivity of business operations and proactively identify areas for efficient use of resources.
  • Build and grow effective relationships and collaboration across numerous internal and cross-functional leaders and use your ability to influence without authority.
title: Partner Vertical Manager, Actions on Google
